CatDescriptText: William Hoyle, 2321 Wylie Avenue and Joshua Bundridge, laborer, Oakland, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 11, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that all bingo games, including those for the benefit of churches, veteran's groups, or hospitals, should be outlawed?" Mr. Hoyle's answer reads: "No, I don't, because it helps churches and other organizations."  Mr. Bundridge's answer reads: "I think they should.  I don't think that it's right to play game like that."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William Hoyle wearing plaid shirt, suit jacket, and eyeglasses, standing under C. A. Michel sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Joshua Bundridge wearing light colored short sleeve button down collared shirt, standing under C.A. Michel sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown
